title: Account Creation flow (including error handling)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN users are loading the app
AND the BP app version is 11.3.0, at minimum*

*11.3.0 introduces Rapid Onboarding (removing FaveTeam and Location pages)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user launches Ballpark for the first time after installation
OR the user launches Ballpark for the first time after upgraded installation
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[ANDROID PAGE 1: Welcome to Ballpark - Get Started]

THEN the Ballpark branded splash screen will be displayed

[SplashScreen_NoKeychain](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1lZh4PsfuJBRlROVLDBhHdoM5JSbaPHXv/view)*

*may need to update with Android specific image

THEN the app loads Get Started page
AND the header text shown is "Welcome to Ballpark. Everything you need for your ballpark visit."
AND 'Get Started' button shown
AND 'Have a MLB account? Log In' text beneath the Get Started button
AND 'Log in' text is blue and is a link
AND a welcome video playing in the background

Note: If loading is taking a long time, display default spinner, near bottom of screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Get Started button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[ANDROID PAGE 2: Sign Up]

THEN 'Create an MLB account to access your digital tickets and exclusive MLB content.' Sign Up page is shown
AND Email Address, Password, First Name, Last Name, Birthdate fields are presented
AND a radio(or check) button is enabled by default under the text fields with 'I would like to receive newsletters and promotions from MLB.com and its partners.'
AND 'Sign Up' button is shown below the opt-in button
AND 'Have an account? Log In' link is shown below Sign Up button
AND 'By signing up, you agree to MLB's Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.' text is shown 
AND 'Terms of Use' and 'Privacy Policy' are links within the text

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN the user does NOT enter data for all fields
WHEN the user taps on 'Sign Up' button on the Create Acct page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'First and Last Name are required.' will be displayed with red text under the First Name and Last Name fields
AND 'Passwords must contain 8 - 15 character, one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, and one number. No special characters allowed.' will be displayed with red text below the Password field
AND 'Please enter a valid birthdate.' will be displayed with red text under the Date Of Birth fields
AND 'There is an error with your email. Please try again' will be displayed with red text below the Email field


AND the account creation is prevented with user unable to proceed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a valid birthdate in proper format 00/00/0000,
BUT user provides a date of birth that is less than 13 years from the current date
AND the user enters valid data for all other required fields
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Sign Up Error' message prompt is shown with 'You are ineligible to complete registration' text
AND the message prompt displays 'OK' link

AND the create account will be prevented

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN the network is down (*can be simulated by placing device in Airplane mode)
WHEN the user enters an Email address that has NOT previously been created
AND the user enters valid data for all other required fields
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Sign Up Error' message prompt is shown with 'Please check your network connection and try again' text
AND the message prompt displays 'OK' link

AND the create account will be prevented

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters valid data* for all fields
AND the email entered HAS a previous MLB account
AND the user taps Sign Up button


valid data:
*First Name is populated (required)
*Last Name is populated (required)
*Email address conforms to standard email rules [i.e '@' symbol, domain(i.e '.com')]
*Password containing at least 1 number, at least 1 uppercase letter, at least 1 lowercase letter, no special characters AND within 8-15 characters in length
*Birthdate within proper amount of digits MM DD YYYY, BUT ALSO a date that is 13 years+ in past from the current date
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Sign Up Error' message prompt is shown with 'An account with this email already exists' text
AND the message prompt displays 'OK' link


AND the create account will be prevented

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN the network is enabled
WHEN the user enters valid data* for all fields
AND the email entered does not have a previous MLB account
AND the user taps Sign Up button


valid data:
*First Name is populated (required)
*Last Name is populated (required)
*Email address conforms to standard email rules [i.e '@' symbol, domain(i.e '.com')]
*Password containing at least 1 number, at least 1 uppercase letter, at least 1 lowercase letter, no special characters AND within 8-15 characters in length
*Birthdate within proper amount of digits MM DD YYYY, BUT ALSO a date that is 13 years+ in past from the current date
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the account is created successfully
AND the user is shown the Home Page

title: Account Creation: Fresh Installation (without keychain) - including error handling
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is loading the app for the very first time on their mobile device after installation


IOS Note: To simulate a fresh install without keychain, navigate to More > About BP > Dev tools provides option to delete the acct stored in keychain *requires debug build

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user launches Ballpark for the first time after installation (without keychain stored)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[iOS PAGE 1: Welcome to Ballpark - Get Started]

THEN the Ballpark branded splash screen will be displayed

[SplashScreen_NoKeychain](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1lZh4PsfuJBRlROVLDBhHdoM5JSbaPHXv/view)

THEN the app loads Get Started page
AND the header text shown is "Welcome to Ballpark. Everything you need for your ballpark visit."
AND 'Get Started' button shown
AND 'Have a MLB account? Log In' text beneath the Get Started button
AND 'Log in' text is blue and is a link
AND a welcome video playing in the background

Note: If loading is taking a long time, display default spinner, near bottom of screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Get Started button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[iOS PAGE 2: Create Account Modal]

THEN 'Create an MLB account to access your digital tickets.' modal is shown
AND Email Address, Password, First Name, Last Name, Birthdate fields are presented
AND a radio button is enabled by default under the text fields with 'I would like to receive newsletters and promotions from MLB.com and its partners.'
AND 'Sign Up' button is shown below the radio button
AND 'By creating an account, you agree to MLB.com's Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.' text is shown below the Sign Up button
AND 'Terms of Use' and 'Privacy Policy' are links within the text

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a First name with 40+ characters
AND taps to another field (OR taps 'return' within keyboard)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Character limit of 40 reached.' error is displayed in Red Font underneath the First Name field
AND the account creation is prevented

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a Last name with 40+ characters
AND taps to another field (OR taps 'return' within keyboard)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Character limit of 40 reached.' error is displayed in Red Font underneath the Last Name field
AND the account creation is prevented

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters an Email address that does not conform to standard email rules (i.e @ symbol missing, domain missing)
AND taps to another field (OR taps 'return' within keyboard)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Please enter a valid email.' error is displayed in Red Font underneath the Email Address field
AND the account creation is prevented

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters an Email address with 40+ characters that conforms to standard email rules (i.e @ symbol missing, domain missing)
AND taps to another field (OR taps 'return' within keyboard)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Character limit of 40 reached.' error is displayed in Red Font underneath the Email Address field
AND the account creation is prevented

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps into Password text field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the device keyboard is presented
AND the password rules are show in grey text with each check box empty

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user enters a special character in the password field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'No special characters' is displayed in red, with the associated circle marked with an X

(if other password requirements are NOT met, they will be red, with the circle marked with an X)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user enters a number in the password field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN '1 number' is displayed in green, with the associated circle marked with a check

(if other password requirements are NOT met, they will be red, with the circle marked with an X)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user enters a lowercase letter in the password field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN '1 lowercase' is displayed in green, with the associated circle marked with a check

(if other password requirements are NOT met, they will be red, with the circle marked with an X)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user enters an uppercase letter in the password field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN '1 uppercase' is displayed in green, with the associated circle marked with a check

(if other password requirements are NOT met, they will be red, with the circle marked with an X)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters less than 8 characters in the password field
OR 	
WHEN the user enters more than 15 characters
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN '8-15 characters' is displayed in red, with the associated circle marked with an X

(if other password requirements are NOT met, they will be red, with the circle marked with an X)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user enters between than 8 characters and 15 characters, inclusively
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN '8-15 characters' is displayed in green, with the associated circle marked with a check

(if other password requirements are NOT met, they will be red, with the circle marked with an X

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps into Birthdate field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the device numeric pad is presented

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user enters an invalid birthdate of 00/00/0000
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Please enter a valid birthdate.' will be displayed with red text under the field
AND the account creation is prevented

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a valid birthdate in proper format 00/00/0000,
BUT user provides a date of birth that is less than 13 years from the current date
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN 'You are ineligible to complete registration' will be displayed with red text above the Sign Up button

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters an Email address for an account that has previously been created
AND the user enters valid data for all other required fields
custom_steps_separated.expected:
There will be an error displayed "An account with this email already exists."
AND the message will be in Red Font
AND the create account will be prevented

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN the network is down (*can be simulated by placing device in Airplane mode)
WHEN the user enters an Email address that has NOT previously been created
AND the user enters valid data for all other required fields
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Sorry, check your network and try again.' is shown with red font text

AND the create account will be prevented

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN the network is enabled
WHEN the user enters valid data* for all fields
AND the email entered does not have a previous MLB account
AND the user taps Sign Up button

valid data:
*Email address with less than 40 characters that conforms to standard email rules [i.e '@' symbol, domain(i.e '.com')]
*Password containing at least 1 number, at least 1 uppercase letter, at least 1 lowercase letter, no special characters AND within 8-15 characters in length
*First Name is within character limit of 40
*Last Name is within character limit of 40
*Birthdate within proper amount of digits 00/00/0000, BUT ALSO a date that is 13 years+ in past from the current date
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the account is created successfully
AND the user is shown the Home Page

Note: A prompt may be shown to allow Ballpark to track activities
Note: A prompt may also be shown to allow Notifications

title: Account Creation: Upgraded installation (with keychain)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user loads the app for the very first time on their mobile device after upgrading from a previous version (and prev logged in)


IOS Note: If prev logged in user creds are stored and is automatically logged in you will be shown Home page - PLEASE LOG OUT. *To logout, navigate to Home > My Profile > Log out button
IOS Note: If 'Welcome Page - Get Started' is shown instead of the desired 'Welcome Page - Continue With MLB'. PLEASE LOG IN WITH EXISTING ACCOUNT (OR ONBOARD A NEW ACCT) TO STORE CREDENTIALS. THEN PLEASE LOG OUT  *To logout, navigate to Home > My Profile > Log out button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user launches Ballpark for the first time after installation (with keychain stored)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[iOS PAGE 3: Welcome to Ballpark - Continue with MLB]

THEN the Ballpark branded splash screen will be displayed

[SplashScreen_KeychainSaved](https://drive.google.com/file/d/18BQM3Md2oi1kCVJgBcs8JAoVz8qdZR93/view)

AND the header text shown is "Welcome to Ballpark. Everything you need for your ballpark visit."
AND 'Continue with MLB' button shown with the acct prev logged in shown above the button
AND 'Log in with another MLB account' text beneath continue with MLB button
AND 'Log in' text is blue and is a link
AND 'Don't have an account? Sign Up' text beneath the log in text
AND 'Sign Up' text is blue and is a link
AND a welcome video playing in the background

Note: If loading is taking a long time, display default spinner, near bottom of screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps the 'Sign Up' link within 'Don't have an account? Sign Up' text
custom_steps_separated.expected:
[iOS PAGE 2: Create Account Modal]
	
THEN 'Create an MLB account to access your digital tickets.' modal is shown
AND Email Address, Password, First Name, Last Name, Birthdate fields are presented
AND a radio button is enabled by default under the text fields with 'I would like to receive newsletters and promotions from MLB.com and its partners.'
AND 'Sign Up' button is shown below the radio button
AND 'By creating an account, you agree to MLB's Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.' text is shown below the Sign Up button
AND 'Terms of Use' and 'Privacy Policy' are links within the text

custom_steps_separated.content: [VALIDATION STEPS AND RESULTS FOR CLIENT-SIDE VALIDATION OF THE ACCOUNT CREATION FIELDS, INCLUDING DOWN NETWORK AND/OR DUPLICATE ACCT CREATION IS COVERED WITHIN [Account Creation: Fresh Installation (without keychain) - including error handling](https://testrail.testeng.mlbinfra.net/index.php?/cases/view/28778252)]
custom_steps_separated.expected: WITH ERROR HANDLING OF SIGNUP PAGE COVERED - NO NEED TO PERFORM WITHIN THIS CASE, SINCE THE PAGE IS REUSED AND WOULD BE IDENTICAL FROM ACCESSIBILITY PERSPECTIVE

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters valid data* for all fields
AND the email entered does not have a previous MLB account
AND the user taps Sign Up button

valid data:
*Email address with less than 40 characters that conforms to standard email rules [i.e '@' symbol, domain(i.e '.com')]
*Password containing at least 1 number, at least 1 uppercase letter, at least 1 lowercase letter, no special characters AND within 8-15 characters in length
*First Name is within character limit of 40
*Last Name is within character limit of 40
*Birthdate within proper amount of digits 00/00/0000, BUT ALSO a date that is 13 years+ in past from the current date
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the account is created successfully
AND the user is shown the Home Page

Note: A prompt may be shown to allow Ballpark to track activities
Note: A prompt may also be shown to allow Notifications
